utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay, great! Bye. So guess who’s coming to Thanksgiving dinner?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Sydney Portier? Hehheh.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I miss Rachel. No, my parents.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh! That’s great, they haven’t seen the place since I moved in!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Yeah, and y’know, if you could not mention to them that we live together, that would be great! , I was thinking we would eat around four.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why can’t I tell them that we live together?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Because they don’t know we’re dating. Do you think we should eat in the kitchen?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why haven’t you told them?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Um, well, I was going to, I-I-I really was. But um, then somewhere, just out of nowhere, I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why haven’t you told them?! Wouldn’t they be happy?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: So! Dinner in the kitchen around four! I’ll see you then.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t they be happy?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, um, because mainly, um, they don’t like you. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What? What? Why?!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Maybe because you used to be aloof, or that you’re really sarcastic, or that, y’know, you joke around all the time. Or that you take off your clothes and throw them on the couch.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Is this why they don’t like me or why you don’t like me?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Look, I know that I should’ve told them. I know I shouldn’t care what they think. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Y’know, it’ll be okay. It’ll be okay. Because when they come over, I will be all charming, I will make them fall in love with me, and then we’ll tell ‘em.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You really think that’ll work?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey, I can be pretty charming, babe, I won YOU over, didn’t I?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I don’t think you’ll ever get my parents that drunk!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey! Oh, good, Ross! You’re parents like me, right?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yes, of course they like you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well Monica just told me that they don’t.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, they don’t like you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Do you know why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I dunno, maybe it’s because you’re really sarcastic. Or maybe it’s cause you uh-

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Well if people don’t know they shouldn’t just guess!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: This is great, another Thanksgiving with nothing to give thanks for.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Maybe I could give thanks for you shuttin’ up, eh?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Maybe I could give thanks by taking my Playstation over to my new apartment.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well maybe I love ya’.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Hey.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Hey guys!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No I don’t want to play video games, Joey!

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Are you guys going to Chandler’s for Thanksgiving?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah! Yeah, why? What’s up?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Well, me and my dancer friends are thinking of doing Thanksgiving uptown. I thought you guys might like to come.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: For real?

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: No, but you should go to Chandler’s. Because none of us knows how to cook, we’ll probably just end up drinking all day.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ye-ye, we go to yours!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, see, we-we-we have to stop across the hall, because it’s my sister. But, uh, uh y’know actually, growing up with a sister was nice because it really helped me understand women. Yeah, you-you should tell your friends that.

utterance.speaker: Janine
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: How you got three women to marry you, I’ll never know.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Hey! Hey, Pheebs, check it out. Yeah, for my desert, I have chosen to make a traditional English truffle!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow, that sounds great! And what are you making Monica, in case Rachel’s dessert is... so good that I eat all of it. There’s none left for anybody else!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Nothing?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: No, sweetie, I-I trust you.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So, if-if I mess this up, there’s nothing else for dessert?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re not gonna mess it up.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Wow, Monica, I love that, you really have faith in me. Thank you. Technical question, how do you know when uh, the butter’s done?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well, it’s done about two minutes before it looks like that.

utterance.speaker: Joey and Ross
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hey!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh, ooh the food smells great, Mon!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And the place looks so nice!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, hey hey, Happy Thanksgiving everybody!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving!

utterance.speaker: The Girls
utterance.content: Happy Thanksgiving!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well, this has been great!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: See ya!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Whoa whoa whoa! Where’re you goin’?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, oh, we did say we’d stop by this little thing Joey’s roommate is having.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Oh, Janine, the really hot dancer girl?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Some would say she’s attractive, yes.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: And who else is going to be there?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Uh, some of her friends, yeah.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Her dancer friends?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yes, all right? All of her hot dancer friends are gonna be there and they’re gonna be, be drinkin’ and dancin, and we really wanna go!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dude, we were good!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You’re not gonna go anywhere, you said you were gonna eat here, and you’re gonna eat here!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, and-and leaving us to go see hot dancer girls is not very Thanksgivingy.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, but-but it is, uh, it’s just like the first Thanksgiving, when the Indians and the Pilgrims uh, sat down to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, and the Indians taught the Pilgrims what it meant to be hot in the new world!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Hello everybody!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Hi!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Dad , Mom . Look! Look who it is it’s Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh yes of course, hello Chandler.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Mr. and Mrs. Geller, you look wonderful, it is great to have you hear, let us take off your coats!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Whoa, snowing out there?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Monica, all this food looks wonderful, you should think about doing this for a living.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Ok, I have dandruff. There’s no need to laugh and point.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Dad, Chandler was just laughing at your joke.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: My joke wasn’t funny.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rach, Rach, I just remembered. I had a dream about Mr. Geller last night.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really?!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, I dreamt that he saved me from a burning building and he was so brave and so strong! And it’s making me look at him totally differently. Y’know, I mean he used to be just, y’know “Jack Geller Monica and Ross’s dad” and now he’s he’s “Jack Geller, dream hunk."

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I dunno. Y’know to me he’ll always be “Jack Geller, walks in while you’re changing.”

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Y’know dad, Chandler is one of Ross’s very best friends!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, Ross sure is a great guy, y’know I’ve always felt that how a young man turns out is a reflection on his father.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I always thought that too. Tell me, what does your father do?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: He’s the headliner of a gay burlesque show.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rach, you’re killin’ us here, will ya serve the dessert already? Those drunken dancers are waiting!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Look at it, isn’t it beautiful?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, what is it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It’s a truffle. It’s got all of these layers. First there’s a layer of ladyfingers, then a layer of jam, then custard, which I made from scratch, then raspberries, more ladyfingers, then beef sauteed with peas and onions, then a little more custard, and then bananas, and then I just put some whipped cream on top!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: W-What was the one right before bananas?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: The beef? Yeah, that was weird to me, too. But then, y’know, I thought “well, there’s mincemeat pie,” I mean that’s an English dessert, these people just put very strange things in their food, y’know. Oh! by the way, can I borrow some Rum from your place?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Y-sure!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: And while I’m gone don’t you boys sneak a taste.

utterance.speaker: Joey and Ross
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Beef in a dessert?! I- no no no, there is no way!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I know, and only one layer of jam?! What is up with that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh my God, the pages are stuck together!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Chandler!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh My God, she-she made half a English Trifle, and half a...Sheperd’s Pie!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh man! Now she’s gonna start all over! We’re never gonna get to introduce the hot girls to the new world!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: No, no, we will. We just won’t tell her she messed up.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just let her serve the beef-custard thing?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, it’ll be like a funny Thanksgiving story!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Vomiting stories are funny...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, God, your apartment is like a hundred degrees!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Did-did it make you wanna walk around in your underwear?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Still not hot enough!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Okay, look at him. Look at those strong hands. Oh what I wouldn’t give to be that can of condensed milk.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mom, uh, Chandler was just saying how beautiful your sweater is.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Oh, thank you Chandler! I just bought it.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Oh, yes. Well it’s very beautiful. It’s cream-colored and tight I don’t mean tight, I mean it’s not too tight, not that I was looking at-

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: What’s the matter with him?

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I think he’s stoned again.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Dude, I need to talk to you a sec.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, I think I might know why my parents don’t like you.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: You do? Why?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, remember, we were young. Hey, Spring break, sophomore year, I got high in my bedroom and my parents walked in and smelled it and so I told them that you had gotten stoned and jumped out the window.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What?! Why did you do that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know, aheh, your’s was the first name that-that popped into my head, I’m I’m sorry. I-I didn’t think it would matter.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: How could it not matter?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: How was I supposed to know we’d end up being friends after college, let alone you-you would be living with my sister?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: What about all that “friends forever” stuff?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I don’t know, I-I was all high.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mom and dad just sent me in here to find out if you were trying to get Ross stoned!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Your parents caught Ross smoking pot in college and he blamed it on me!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, I can’t believe you’d do that!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: The reason we haven’t told them we’re together is because they hate me, okay? So will you fix this?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay, I’ll tell ‘em it wasn’t Chandler who got high. Now who should I say it was?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: You! It’s not like it’s a big deal! You-you don’t still do it or anything!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Alright, alright, now-now who should I say tricked me into doing it?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Dad, please don’t pick your teeth out here! Alright, and if you’re gonna put your feet up, why don’t you sit on the-

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Monica, leave him alone!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Will you hurry up? Did you not hear me before when I told you that all of Janine’s friends are dancers?! And that they’re going to be drinking alot!?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I did, but tell me again, because it’s so romantic.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Well you’re whippin’ so slow! Can’t you do it any faster?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey! Come on! I don’t wanna make any mistakes, alright? This is the only dessert and if I screw it up everybody's gonna be like “Oh, remember that Thanksgiving when Rachel screwed up the trifle?”

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: So why don’t you just let me worry about making the trifle and you just worry about eating it, alright?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh I am!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross, if you don’t tell them, then I will!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, fine!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Ross! Can I talk to you for a second?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh, uh, can it wait a second Joey? I have to tell my parents something. No it can’t? Okay.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Okay, look, I think we have to tell Rachel she messed up her dessert.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?! What is with everybody? It’s Thanksgiving, not...Truth-Day!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Look, when everyone eats that...that...Banana-Meat thing, they’re all gonna’ make fun of her, do you want that?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Okay, okay, we’ll just get everyone to act like they like it. That-that way noone makes fun of her and we still get to go to Sweet Potatoe Pie!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Dude, they’re not objects.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Just kiddin,’ I’ll talk to them, you distract Rach.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Hey Rach, can I talk to you outside for a second?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay...

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: What’s up, Ross?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: So um...Thanksgiving. The holiday season is upon us, hm?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Yeah!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: And um...You look nice today.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh no. No Ross, don’t do this.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I just- I don’t think us getting back together is a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Eh?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I thought this might happen today. Ross, I know the holidays can be rough. Y’know? And it’s probably really hard for you to be alone right now.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You’re alone.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I-I live with Phoebe. I mean you’re alone, alone. And I just-it’s just not the time for us. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Ah well, can’t blame a guy for trying!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Oh and Okay, and uh if anyone needs help pretending to like it, I learned something in acting class, try uh, rubbing your stomach or uh, or saying “mmm” and uh, oh oh! And smiling , okay?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, I’m not gonna pay for those acting classes anymore.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Rachel, there you are! Come on, let’s serve that dessert already!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Joey, you’re gonna have to stop rushing me, you know what? You don’t get any dessert.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: No, I’m just kidding I would never do that to you! Okay, everybody, it’s trifle time!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: So, now, Rach, this is a traditional English trifle, isn’t it?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: It sure is.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Wow. So then did you make it with beef or Eggplant?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Beef.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I can’t have any. You know I don’t eat meat. Ohhh no.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Alright, Monica, I want you to have the first taste.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Really?

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh oh oh, wait! You only got whipped cream in there! Ya gotta take a bite with all the layers!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Op! Wait, you dropped a pea.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Well?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mmmm! It’s good!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Really? How good?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: It’s so good, that I feel really selfish about being the only one who’s eating it, that I think we should have everyone taste how good it is. Especially Ross.

utterance.speaker: All
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yeah, this is so good, that I’m gonna go enjoy it on the balcony so that I can enjoy the view whilst I enjoy my dessert.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: I’ve gotta call my friend Mary and tell her how good this is, from Monica’s room.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: I’ll help you dial.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: I’m gonna go into the bathroom so I can look at it in the mirror, as I eat it.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Okay, now what was that all about? Is it-does it not taste good? Let me try it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wha? No no! Ah! All gone! So good! Maybe Chandler has some left.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: It tastes like feet!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I like it.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Are you kidding?

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: What’s not to like? Custard? Good. Jam? Good. Meat? Gooooood.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: ...So a bird just grabbed it, and then tried to fly away with it and, and then just dropped it on the street?

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Yes, but if it’s any consolation, before the bird dropped it, he seemed to enjoy it.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Rachel, come here. Okay, I was just starting to take my Thanksgiving nap, and I had another dream about Jack.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh, Phoebe, do I wanna hear this?

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I dunno, let’s see! So, okay, I dreamt that we were gonna get married, and he left, becuz he had to go fight a fire. And, um, so okay, I went to a night club, and I saw him making out with a girl.

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: Oh my God, he dream-cheated on you!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Yeah, but then Jacques Cousteau came and he kicked his ass for betraying me! It was soo cool! Then, he took me diving and he introduced me to his pet seahorse, who, by the way, was totally coming on to me, and please, that is not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: Boy, I’m glad I wore the big belt today.

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: Five minutes ago, a line like that would’ve floored me. Now nothing. Well, not nothing, I am still a woman.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross? Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Oh yeah, about telling Mom and Dad, I was thinking about maybe writing a letter.

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Alright, you know what? That’s it. You’ve had your chance.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Wha-what?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Mom! Dad! Ross smoked pot in college!

utterance.speaker: Mr. and Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: What?!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: You are such a tattletale! Mom, Dad, you remember that-that time you walked in my room and smelled marijuana?

utterance.speaker: Mr. and Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Well I told you it was Chandler who was smoking the pot but it was me. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: It was you?

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: And Dad, y’know that mailman that you got fired? He didn’t steal your Playboys! Ross did!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Yeah, well, Hurricane Gloria didn’t break the porch swing, Monica did!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross hasn’t worked at the museum for a year!

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: Monica and Chandler are living together!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Ross married Rachel in Vegas! And got divorced! Again!!!!

utterance.speaker: Phoebe
utterance.content: I love Jacques Cousteau!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: I wasn’t supposed to put beef in the trifle!

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: I wanna gooooooo!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: That’s alot of information to get in in thirty seconds! Alright Joey, if wanna leave, just leave. Rachel, no you weren’t supposed to put beef in the trifle. It did not taste good. Phoebe, I’m sorry, but I think Jacques Cousteau is dead. Monica, why you felt you had to hide the fact that you were in an important relationship is beyond me.

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: And we kinda figured about the porch swing.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Ross, drugs? Divorced? Again?

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: What happened son?

utterance.speaker: Ross
utterance.content: I-I uh, I got tricked into all those things!

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Chandler! You’ve been Ross’s best friend all these years, stuck by him during the drug problems. And now you’ve taken on Monica as well. Well, I don’t know what to say. You’re a wonderful human being.

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: Thank you!

utterance.speaker: Mr. Geller
utterance.content: No! Thank you! Monica, and Ross! I don’t know what I’m gonna do about the two of you!

utterance.speaker: Chandler
utterance.content: I’ll talk to them!

utterance.speaker: Rachel
utterance.content: You guys! It was bananas, cream, and beef! I-I just cannot believe that you ate that so that I wouldn’t feel bad!

utterance.speaker: Monica
utterance.content: Well actually, I-I didn’t eat mine. It’s still in the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: No it isn’t, I ate that.

utterance.speaker: Mrs. Geller
utterance.content: Well we left ours in Monica’s bedroom.

utterance.speaker: Joey
utterance.content: Nope, got it and I got yours too.
